heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 26 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 67.0m lower than yesterday, 213.5m higher than the past week, 62.4m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 789m to a maximum of 2540m, averaging 1404.3m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1190.8m and 1341.9m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and calm and still conditions are expected. Drizzle or light rain possible, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and some sunny spells will occur. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (89%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
